Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for price but dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: KickinKath
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Hotel Derby and for the price i paid I cant complain, It is a basic 3 star hotel, it is clean and the reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is very standard, there is a choice of cereal, yoghurt, iced croissants, bread, ham and cheese and apples. The hotel was only 10 mins walk from the metro station so it was very easily accessible to the centre of Rome, the Coliseum metro was only 2 or 3 stops away. The room I stayed in was fine, it had a balcony and air conditioning, it was an average size, the bathroom was really clean and the room was cleaned everyday, it also had a tv but no tea or coffee facilities The only negative about this hotel is the area it is in - Garbatella. As soon as we arrived and walked out of the metro station....it was very smelly and the area was absolutely covered in rubbish, there is not a lot around. There are a couple of pizza restaurants that are cheap to eat at but I wouldn't recommend, also no one speaks any sort of English in this area it is a very typical Italian suburb.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: We only had a two-night break in Rome and the hotel was well situated, only 3 stops on the metro from the Colisseum (the metro is easy to use). Not in the centre so stay in town if you are looking for a restaurant in the evening. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast. Comfortable room, large, clean, comfortable bed. Only one hitch - the room fronted the main road so there was traffic noise until quite late and then again from around 6.30-7.00 in the morning.Bathroom a bit small and maybe needed some "freshening-up". Overall a good hotel and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ClioChick7
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the metro station in a busy but pleasant suburb, the Hotel Derby is an ideal base for seeing the sights of Rome, especially on a budget. We got a Groupon deal which included breakfast and was great value for money. At first, we were given a tiny room on the corner of the 1st floor (109) but when we asked to change this the receptionist obliged and we got a good-sized room (108) which looked out onto a road but was fairly quiet. The rooms are clean and airy and have satellite TV, a fridge and air con but no tea/coffee facilities - luckily we were prepared though! The bathroom was OK with a good shower. The continental breakfast was very nice with a good selection of cereals, yogurts, fruit, etc. We were also served glazed croissants which were delicious! For dinner, there are a few nice restaurants in the area and the city centre is very easily accessible. As with many places in Rome, the staff were friendly, helpful, and spoke very good English. Overall, we were pleased with our stay, especially for the price - and we even got lucky with the weather!

Reviews.Title: “Giorgio on reception was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer N
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in Hotel Derby, the room was small, but very clean, and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good, a large selection. Giorgio on reception was so friendly and helpful. He recommended great restaurants, and helped us book some of our day trips, I would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: eepwa
Reviews.Content: For Rome it was pretty cheap and it included breakfast which was good. It was in a good area because it was about a 5 min walk from the nearest subway station (Garbatella) and a 5 min subway ride to the Coliseum subway station. The Rome subway system is very easy to use. The room is a good size for two people and it has a fridge and safe. If I am ever in Rome again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Karel_Andrea
Reviews.Content: We have chosen this hotel on the base of reviews and we have to say, that it matched on most of all points. Hotel is located outside the centre in lets say "calm area". Rooms are smaller but for two persons its enough. Rooms are clean, and good equipped with TV, small refrigerator and AC. Our room had a balcony with a view to old houses. Hotel is near the local road but in the night traffic is not so huge and sleeping is comfortable with closed windows. Staff would like to be assisted, we have met only one time with receptionist who was not able to say the word in English, but it was late when we´ve arrived so we are suppose that he was only in night service. Breakfast was in common style - no problem, we did not have the dinner there so we cannot do review. We would recomment this 3* hotel , its not in the centre, but its approx 15min walking to metro (station Garbatella).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice indeed for the price”
Reviews.Author: italy_loverUk
Reviews.Content: Positives: Very helpful Staff, rooms cleaned to a high standard, good quality TV with many channels in English, Clean bathroom, generally a very nice hotel. For Rome it was also quite cheap but that's because it is located 5 metro stops from the main sights so as long as you don't mind that then I would recommend this hotel without any real issues. Negatives: Air con was a bit dodgy and traffic outside was quite loud- In the winter I don't think either of these would matter as the rooms are double glazed but we just didn't close them to get some breeze. Breakfast is basic but did us. In short good value hotel a little out but Metro stop is only 5-10 min walk so that wasn't an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and affordable small hotel in a very nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: VladoNik
Reviews.Content: The place was really nice and cozy, the personnel were very kind and basically everything was as we have wished it to be on our stay. The breakfast was nice, on a beautiful terrace. The bed was comfortable, the bath was big. I do recommend it to any one looking for a best-value 3 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent budget hotel in the old Rome”
Reviews.Author: olegkravitz
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location Derby: city center, quiet area, 10 minutes walk from the subway station Garbatella (4 stops to the Colosseum), next to the hotel there are food stalls and cafes. Especially liked the room: we lived on the 3 floor with a balcony - a beautiful panorama of the old city, more than 100 channels of satellite TV, a delicious breakfast (although the choice is not very big, but hearty). Staff very friendly + low price. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: kaltayl
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews before my stay to derby and now that I m back I can say my opinion. The hotel is an excellent value for money. It is situated in Garbatella, which is a quiet place with all kinds of shops nearby, I mean ALL! It's a nice and picturesque place away from the hustle and bustle of central Rome and the awful neighbourhood of termini. it is only 5-7 min from the metro station (yes I timed it and I m not fit!and it is easy to find even for me that I m a woman ;)) which is never crowded! and 2 stops from Colosseo (the only station u will need if you want to go sightseeing in ancient Rome)and 4 stops from Eur if you have a business meeting. Clean hotel with very kind and helpful staff. Yes it is a bit old but it is renovated. The breakfast is basic. In my previous stay in Rome I stayed in a hotel in termini which costed 50e more, it had the same breakfast, the same rooms, worst staff ever, drug addicts at the threshold and the awfully crowded termini station. If I ever go back I ll stay there!

Reviews.Title: “So near to Colosseum and so quiet”
Reviews.Author: RockSays
Reviews.Content: Being our first Europe trip, we booked this hotel based on travelers reviews and I'm sure that we won't be disappointed. We reached Rome from Barcelona around 10 PM in the night and we took a shared cab from Fiumicino Airport and it took an hour to reach the hotel. We were happy that there is someone at the reception to receive us and they are English speaking (which is blessing for us). First impression, a very nice hotel in a quiet residential area. Reception was nice and check-in was very quick say around 5 minutes. Hotel has 4 floors with breakfast and reception on the ground floor and it has 2 elevators. We were little disappointed that there is no elevator for 4th floor (where we have given room) and we had trouble taking our huge bag one floor up. Room was clean & nice with some antic kind of look; it was small & good enough for two and for that price. All basic and needed stuff like TV, Aircon, heater, hair dryer and with safety locker inside the room are available. Shower cubicle in the bathroom is too small and it’s not easy for someone who little heavy. There is NO restaurant in the hotel and no room service too. They serve only breakfast in the morning and apart from that nothing else. There is a small pizza store just outside the hotel and the food isn't great. Couples of eating places mostly take away near to the hotel. Breakfast was good with sweet stuff and cold meat. Best thing about this place is its very near to the center of tourist center. There is metro station nearby called “Garbatella” (blue line) and it takes 20mins walk from hotel. It is 3 stops away from the great Colosseum metro. All major attractions are in the metro blue-line and if want to go to Vatican, need to change to red line at Termini and Termini is regional/international train station. We had no trouble reaching the hotel or walking from Metro station to hotel even at 9 PM night and the roads are mostly empty at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendedxr”
Reviews.Author: pariol1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Derby is a haven of tranquillity and friendliness away the frenzy of central Rome. The public areas are spacious and cheerful and our room was large, light and airy with balcony and an excellent bathroom. The proprietor is cheerful, friendly, concerned and helpful, speaks good English and is full of enthusiasm for and information about his area of Rome. It is within easy walking distance of the Porta St Paolo, the Protestant Cemetery and the Basilica of St Pauls without the Walls. It is close to EUR, two train stations (with the nearest metro at Ostiense), an excellent suburban shopping centre and lots of cafes and restaurants. It is reasonably close to Leonardo da Vinci and car pick-up and drop-off depots. There is no long-term parking immediately by the hotel, but there is street parking close by. For those who want the experience of a non-touristy part of Rome, this is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Unplanned stay, but very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DrewK
Reviews.Content: I spent an unplanned 5 nights here as my wife had to be hospitalised at nearby CTO Hospital after fracturing her knee on broken stairs at Ostiense Station on our way to the airport leaving Rome for Mykonos. The front office staff, especially Giorgio who could speak excellent English, were extremely helpful as I had much organising to do. They assisted me with phonecalls, faxing, the internet, printing, etc. Eventually we actually decided to leave the hospital after they kept delaying the surgery and return to South Africa for the operation, but all this required much paperwork for travel insurance purposes. The breakfasts were adequate and the staff even packed a croissant, some butter and jam and fruit for my wife as some of the food in the hospital was no great. Thanks for this!! I would not choose to stay at this hotel again as it is too far out of the centre of Rome, but I would like to say that it definitly was a good base for being close to the hospital. Thanks to all the staff for their help.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money with easy access to city centre”
Reviews.Author: MID3347
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and was delighted to have a clean room, which although not spacious had a generously large bed. Room was clean including bathroom with hairdryer. Unfortunateley there was no hot water on arrival at midnight or early evening but hot water available at breakfast time. The reception staff were very friendly and there are tare-off city maps available in reception at all times. The hotel is in a quiet location only 5 minute walk from metro station Gartello which is then only 4-5 stops from city centre -Termini. Breakfast is adequate with croissants, conflakes and fruit available with coffee, tea, hot chocolate and fruit juice. Overall I would definitely return to this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, dependable hotel”
Reviews.Author: russr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 days (unplanned) at the Derby while my wife had surgery and recuperated at the nearby CTO Hospital. I stayed in a small single room that was well cared for and had everything I needed. The front desk staff was always helpful. The location is quite good with small pizza places and nice restaurants nearby. The Metro is about a 15 minute walk away. The hotel is not centrally located, but it was definitely convenient for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Grate time in Derby hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nusik
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay in this lovely hotel.We want to thank the charming staff and Mr. George especially. Thank you for home-like feeling. The rooms are very clean and lovely. The zone in which the hotel is located is full of trees and cute buildings. The hotel is located near to metro station "Garbatella" (7-10 minutes to walk). Many thanks and we're sure that we will come back.
